intro: Pachylaena atriplicifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of its host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is native to regions of Africa, particularly in countries like South Africa. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in small umbels. Its berries are usually red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have a significant impact on the health of its host trees if left unchecked.
